definition: black dragon/unexpected mistake or mishap/own goal (soccer)/oolong (tea)/(Tw) (loanword from Japanese) udon
abbr. for Ukraine 烏克蘭|乌克兰[Wu1 ke4 lan2]/surname Wu
to mess sth up/to screw up

sentences.english: Based on the practical example, the methods of this paper are proved to be feasibility and rationality.
sentences.chinese: 最后，论文以乌龙山隧道为例，进行实例分析和计算。

sentences.english: Mount Ah Li Rui is a type of oolong tea that has an oxidation level of 30 percent.
sentences.chinese: 阿栗瑞山是乌龙茶的类型有氧化水平的百分之30。

sentences.english: The best oolong tea is bohea produced in the Wuyi Mountains of Fujian Province.
sentences.chinese: 最好的乌龙茶是产在福建武夷山的武夷岩茶。

sentences.english: Waitress:We have black tea, green tea and Wulong tea. Which kind would you like to order?
sentences.chinese: 有红茶，绿茶还有乌龙茶等等。您要喝哪种？

sentences.english: Shortly after this slip, Escobar was shot and killed in what many people view as a related incident.
sentences.chinese: 很多人都认为他的死与这个乌龙球有关。

sentences.english: There has never been an own goal in the World Cup Final.
sentences.chinese: 世界杯决赛还从来没有出现过乌龙球。

sentences.english: Put the rice in the bowl, pour the hot Oolong tea, mix together and serve.
sentences.chinese: 将白饭盛人碗内，冲入乌龙茶，伴匀即可食用。

sentences.english: Besides jasmine , do you prefer black tea of oolong ?
sentences.chinese: 除茉莉花茶外，你喜欢红茶还是乌龙茶？

sentences.english: You can't blame the referee for the own-goal at the end but the time?
sentences.chinese: 最后时刻的乌龙球你不能怪裁判，但是时间呢？

sentences.english: Well, besides jasmine, do you like black tea or Oolong?
sentences.chinese: 好，除了茉莉花茶，你喜欢红茶或乌龙茶吗？

sentences.english: Oolong suppresses dental plaque and helps prevent cavities.
sentences.chinese: 乌龙茶能抑制牙菌斑及帮助预防蛀牙。

sentences.english: Yes, it belongs to oolong genera .
Is it a variety of oolong tea？
Muzha Tie Guan Yin is a type of oolong tea that is nicknamed the "Iron Goddess."
sentences.chinese: 木栅铁观音是乌龙茶的类型，绰号“铁观音。

definition: to mess sth up/to screw up
to lift a siege/to help sb out of trouble or embarrassment
to burst or force open a door/to excommunicate sb (from the Roman Catholic Church)/to score a goal (in football, hockey etc)
to pull back/to regain (one's dignity etc)/to recover from (an adverse situation)/to turn the tables
hat trick (when one player scores three goals)
(mining) roof fall/to have the roof cave in
to deal the fatal blow (sports, chess etc)/to score the winning point
